item.title: 从 Alphabet 到 Visa，美国巨头推动欧元债券大涨
item.description: 美国公司正在排队用欧元借贷，今年迄今为止的债券销售额达到了创纪录的 1,000 亿美元，这反映了欧洲具有吸引力的融资条件，以及发行人和投资者越来越愿意从美元转向欧元。【原文：U.S. companies are lining up to borrow in euros with bond sales hitting a record $100 billion so far this year, reflecting attractive European funding conditions and a growing willingness among issuers and investors to shift away from the dollar.】

item.title: Meta 将在 "连接"（Connect）年度盛会上首次推出成本更低的带显示屏的智能眼镜
item.description: 尽管 Meta 公司在其社交媒体平台上处理儿童安全问题时面临着严格审查，但预计该公司将在周三举行的年度 Connect 活动上推出新款智能眼镜，加倍努力开发人工智能增强现实产品。【原文：Meta is expected to double down on AI-powered augmented reality products with new smart glasses at its annual Connect event on Wednesday, even as the company faces scrutiny over its handling of child safety on its social media platforms.】

item.title: 美国期货因美联储降息预期而上扬；零售销售数据拭目以待
item.description: 在上一交易日 S&P 500 指数和纳斯达克指数创下收盘纪录新高之后，周二美国股指期货逐步走高，原因是投资者对美联储本周晚些时候的降息仍抱有期望。【原文：U.S. stock index futures inched higher on Tuesday after the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq closed at record highs in the previous session, as investors remained expectant about interest rate cuts from the Federal Reserve later this week.】

item.title: 文件显示，越航将在长期延误后接收首架波音 737 MAX 飞机
item.description: 越南越捷航空公司（VietJet）的公司和国家文件显示，在下订单九年多之后，该公司将接收其首架波音 737 MAX 飞机，而河内正继续与美国就关税问题进行谈判。【原文：Vietnamese airline VietJet is set to take delivery of its first Boeing 737 MAX aircraft more than nine years after placing an order, company and state documents show, as Hanoi continues talks with the U.S. on tariffs.】

item.title: 福特将在德国科隆电动汽车工厂裁员 1000 人
item.description: 美国汽车制造商福特公司周二在一份声明中表示，由于需求疲软，该公司将在德国科隆市的电动汽车生产部门裁员多达 1000 人。【原文：Ford will cut up to 1,000 jobs in electric car production in the German city of Cologne due to weak demand, the U.S. carmaker said in a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: Databricks 参股 Indicium，首次投资拉美初创企业
item.description: Databricks 收购了数据和人工智能咨询公司 Indicium 的少数股份。【原文：Databricks has acquired a minority stake in data and artificial intelligence consultancy Indicium, the companies said on Tuesday, marking the San Francisco-based firm's first investment in a startup founded in Latin America.】

item.title: 消息人士称，中国腾讯计划发行等值 10 亿美元的点心债券
item.description: 据两位直接知情的消息人士透露，中国游戏和社交媒体领军企业腾讯控股正计划通过三期离岸人民币债券交易筹集相当于 10 亿美元的资金。【原文：Chinese gaming and social media leader Tencent Holdings is aiming to raise the equivalent of $1 billion in a three-tranche offshore yuan bond deal, according to two sources with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，英伟达面向中国市场推出的全新 RTX6000D 芯片并未受到大型企业的青睐
item.description: 两位了解采购讨论情况的人士说，英伟达为中国市场量身定制的最新人工智能芯片RTX6000D需求冷淡，一些大型科技公司选择不下单。【原文：Nvidia's RTX6000D, its newest artificial intelligence chip tailored for the Chinese market, has seen only lukewarm demand with some major tech firms opting not to place orders, two people with knowledge of procurement discussions said.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，Stellantis将因燃油泵问题召回超过5.3万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）周二表示，克莱斯勒旗下的斯泰兰特公司因燃油泵问题在美国召回53849辆汽车，该问题可能导致燃油流量损失和驱动力损失。【原文：Chrysler-owner Stellantis is recalling 53,849 vehicles in the U.S. due to an issue with fuel pump, which can result in a loss of fuel flow and loss of drive power, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 全球投资退缩，澳大利亚推迟首次海上风电拍卖
item.description: 澳大利亚维多利亚州以全球投资障碍为由，推迟了海上风电场的首次融资拍卖，这对该国从燃煤发电向可再生能源转型至关重要的产业来说是一个挫折。【原文：Australia's Victoria state has postponed its inaugural auction for offshore wind farm funding, citing global investment hurdles, in a setback to an industry deemed vital to the country's transition from coal-fired power to renewable energy.】

item.title: 英美资源集团与 Codelco 敲定 50 亿美元智利铜矿交易
item.description: 英美资源集团（Anglo American）和智利国营铜业巨头Codelco公司（COBRE.UL）周二称，双方已敲定联合运营邻近智利矿山的协议，旨在释放至少50亿美元的价值。【原文：Anglo American and Chilean state-run copper giant Codelco (COBRE.UL) said on Tuesday they have finalised an agreement to jointly operate their neighbouring Chilean mines, aiming to unlock at least $5 billion in value.】

item.title: 新任首席执行官努诺-马托斯（Nuno Matos）清理门户，澳新银行投资者做好短期阵痛的准备
item.description: 澳新银行集团（ANZ Group）的投资者愿意支持新任首席执行官努诺-马托斯（Nuno Matos）重振这家澳大利亚银行颓势的战略，但他们正准备应对近期的打击，包括可能的股息削减。【原文：ANZ Group investors are willing to back new CEO Nuno Matos' strategy to resuscitate the Australian bank's flagging fortunes, but they are gearing up for near-term hits, including a possible dividend cut.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行高层表示，随着规模扩大，澳大利亚养老基金将扩大外汇套期保值的使用范围
item.description: 澳大利亚央行的一位高级官员周二表示，澳大利亚养老基金将不得不扩大外汇对冲的使用范围，因为该行业的规模可能会扩大，成为全球第二大行业，海外投资的份额也会增加。【原文：Australian pension funds will have to expand the use of foreign exchange hedging as the sector is likely to grow in size to become the second-largest globally with a larger share of investments going abroad, a top central banker said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 中国钢材出口有望再创新高，面临关税进一步反弹的风险
item.description: 今年，中国的钢铁出口量将创下历史新高，打破了前所未有的贸易壁垒将导致出货量下降的预测，并有可能引发针对世界主要生产国的更激烈的保护主义反弹。【原文：China's steel exports are set to hit an all-time high this year, defying predictions that unprecedented trade barriers would drive down shipments, and threaten to provoke an even fiercer protectionist backlash against the world's dominant producer.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，中国征收关税后，越南饲料制造商购买加拿大菜籽粕
item.description: 三位贸易商周二表示，在中国（加拿大菜籽粕的传统买家）今年早些时候征收高额反倾销税以抑制采购后，越南的饲料加工厂正在利用加拿大菜籽粕的低价优势。【原文：Feed millers in Vietnam are taking advantage of bargain prices for Canadian canola meal after China, the product's traditional buyer, curbed purchases by imposing hefty anti-dumping duties earlier this year, three traders said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 越南要求美国重新考虑海产品出口禁令
item.description: 越南已要求美国重新考虑一项可能导致从明年起禁止越南部分海产品出口到美国市场的决定，这对已经受到美国关税打击的越南经济是一个潜在的打击。【原文：Vietnam has asked the United States to reconsider a decision that could lead to a ban on some Vietnamese seafood exports to the American market starting next year, a potential blow to an economy already hit by U.S. tariffs.】

item.title: 黄金上行趋势保持不变，但在 2026 年突破 4,000 美元之前将出现修正
item.description: 交易商和业内专家表示，黄金连续创下历史新高的强劲涨势显示出今年下半年仍将持续的迹象，但在2026年突破每盎司4000美元的里程碑之前，黄金将出现健康的修正。【原文：Gold's stellar rally to successive record highs shows every sign of continuing for the rest of the year, but a healthy correction is on the cards before breaching the $4,000 per ounce milestone in 2026, traders and industry experts said.】

item.title: 中国 19 万亿美元的股票市场曾被称为不可投资的市场，如今再次吸引了外国人的目光
item.description: 外国投资者在撤出中国股市并认为中国股市不可投资三年后，正计划大举重返中国股市，他们受到了中国股市所提供的科技机会的鼓舞，以及对美国资产以外的多元化需求的增长。【原文：Foreign investors are plotting a return to China's stock markets in a big way three years after pulling back and terming them uninvestable, encouraged by the tech opportunities on offer, and a growing demand for diversification beyond U.S. assets.】

item.title: 洞察力：美国在全面的海事任务中瞄准中国对全球港口的控制
item.description: 据三位熟悉该计划的消息人士透露，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的政府正致力于削弱中国的全球港口网络，并将更多战略码头置于西方控制之下。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's administration is on a mission to weaken China's global network of ports and bring more strategic terminals under Western control, according to three sources familiar with the plan.】

item.title: 国际能源机构称全球油气田衰退率正在上升
item.description: 国际能源机构周二表示，由于更加依赖页岩和深海资源，全球油气田产量的自然下降速度正在加快。这意味着企业需要加快投资步伐，才能保持产量持平。【原文：The natural rate of decline in output from the world's oil and gas fields is speeding up, owing to more reliance on shale and deep offshore resources, the International Energy Agency said on Tuesday. That means companies will need to step up the pace of investment just to keep output flat.】

item.title: OpenAI 聘请前 xAI 首席财务官 Mike Liberatore 担任业务财务官
item.description: OpenAI 公司发言人周二告诉路透社，该公司已聘请埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）旗下 xAI 公司的前财务总监迈克-利伯拉托里（Mike Liberatore）担任这家人工智能初创公司的业务财务官，负责监督其人工智能基础设施。【原文：OpenAI has hired Mike Liberatore, former finance chief at Elon Musk's xAI, to be the artificial intelligence startup's business finance officer, responsible for overseeing its AI infrastructure, a company spokesperson told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 智能手机制造商 Nothing 以 13 亿美元的估值融资 2 亿美元
item.description: 总部位于伦敦的智能手机制造商Nothing周二以13亿美元的估值从老虎环球（Tiger Global）为首的一批投资者手中融资2亿美元，以寻求在其产品中整合人工智能。【原文：London-based smartphone maker Nothing on Tuesday raised $200 million from a group of investors led by Tiger Global at a valuation of $1.3 billion as it seeks to integrate artificial intelligence in its products.】

item.title: 特朗普将对《纽约时报》提起 150 亿美元的诽谤和中伤诉讼
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一表示，他将对《纽约时报》提起价值 150 亿美元的诽谤和中伤诉讼。【原文：U.S President Donald Trump said on Monday that he will be filing a $15 billion defamation and libel lawsuit against The New York Times .】

item.title: 据 CBS 新闻报道，甲骨文是帮助 TikTok 在美国继续运营的公司之一
item.description: 据哥伦比亚广播公司（CBS）周一报道，如果中美之间的框架协议最终达成，甲骨文公司将成为使 TikTok 能够在美国继续运营的企业集团之一。【原文：Oracle is among a consortium of firms that would enable TikTok to continue operations in the United States if a framework deal between the U.S. and China is finalized, CBS News reported on Monday.】

item.title: 优衣库创始人柳井正表示美国可能受关税影响最大
item.description: 时装品牌优衣库的日本创始人周一表示，美国可能会在关税对全球贸易的影响中付出最大的代价。【原文：The Japanese founder of fashion brand Uniqlo said on Monday the U.S. may bear the highest price from the impact of tariffs on global trade.】

item.title: 澳大利亚希望在青少年社交媒体禁令下进行 "侵入性最小 "的年龄检查
item.description: 澳大利亚周二敦促社交媒体平台采用 "侵入性最小 "的方法来检查其世界首创的青少年社交媒体禁令所涵盖的用户年龄，这些方法考虑到了人工智能（AI）和行为数据。【原文：Australia urged social media platforms on Tuesday to employ "minimally invasive" methods to check the age of users covered by its world-first teen social media ban, which take into account artificial intelligence (AI) and behavioural data.】

item.title: 投资者关注美联储减息，亚洲股市再创新高，美元徘徊不前
item.description: 周二，亚洲股市攀升，美元走低，因为投资者押注美国联邦储备委员会将在本周恢复宽松周期，并可能为进一步降息敞开大门。【原文：Asia stocks climbed on Tuesday while the dollar was on the back foot as investors bet the U.S. Federal Reserve would resume its easing cycle this week and potentially leave the door open to further rate cuts.】
